reviews.review: I’m emotionally wrecked now but still have to give it 5 stars. Excellent movie but if you are a fan that is emotional invested in these characters like I am, prepare yourselves!
Excellent amount of each hero. Everybody got the screen time that they deserve. -Unfortunately AntMan wasn’t there

I love Marvel movies, but they phoned the story in on this one. Thanos was a great character, but good have been conveyed better. There were several dead spots in the movie, more than I would have expected. I feel that with too many heroes on screen that each one isn’t on screen long enough to make enough of an impact.
Such a good movie. It is now my favorite of all the avengers movies!
Not sure how you can give this movie anything but 5 stars

Wowwww. Just. WOWWWW. I’m not a comic book reader. I didn’t know who Thanos was. I intentionally didn’t watch the trailer. I’ve seen all the other MCU movies. I freakin loved this one and i was expecting it to be good, but not amazingggggg. A+++++

Avengers Infinity War was surprisingly pretty great, all the characters are great including Thanos who is a fantastic villain, really thanos makes this movie great, and makes it what it is, because it is about him, and everything with Thanos was really fascinating and great. All the interactions with the characters were great and entertaining, the visual effects are surprisingly really amazing, the action was fun, the story was surprisingly very well done, and you never feel bored at all because of how engaging it is and how fascinating the movie and villain is. It’s such an ambitious piece of filmmaking, it took risks, it was darker than most Marvel movies, it looked fantastic, the Russo brothers bring a really interesting and fascinating style to this movie,its really surprising, and the movie has a really strong ending. This is probably the one of the best movies of the year so far. Along with it being the best Marvel movie.

While most of the movie was a decent Marvel movie, the contrived "killing off" of so many characters that will almost definitely just be brought back to life by the end of the next movie (many of them have already sequels) struck me as contrived and cheap.
